message.content:
Neural Networks, Local Methods. 

Neural Networks: The paper extensively discusses the use of the multi-layer perceptron (MLP) global neural network model for function approximation. 

Local Methods: The paper also discusses the use of local approximation models, such as the single nearest-neighbour model and the linear local approximation (LA) model, for function approximation. The paper compares the performance of these local methods with the global MLP model. The paper also suggests a method for choosing between the two approaches based on the spread of the density histogram of the k-NN estimates for the training datasets.
